title: How to Create a Chain of Award Ribbons

steps.headline: Choose ribbon or string.
steps.description: The ribbon or string must be strong and of a suitable length.

steps.headline: Measure the length needed.
steps.description: Lay the award ribbons down, side by side. Do you want them right next to each other, or with a gap between them? This should be included in the final measurement. Also leave a little bit extra at each end of the ribbon or string, for hanging with.

steps.headline: Cut ribbon or string to the measurement you've decided upon.
Attach the award ribbons to the ribbon or string.
steps.description:
There are several possible ways for doing this, including these ones:
Attach the award ribbons from any loop or hanger the ribbons have; or attach a loop to them. If the award ribbons don't have a hole in them, you might consider punching one into it and threading it onto the ribbon or string. Just staple or tape the award ribbons to the ribbon or string length. Clip in place using small hair clips, paperclips or small stationery clips.

steps.headline: Hang up the award ribbon chain in your chosen place.
Purchase a length of chain from the hardware store.
steps.description: Take along a measurement that you have already chosen; do this by measuring the area where you'll hang the ribbons.

steps.headline: Find jump rings.
steps.description: These are the wire joining rings used for jewelry making and are ideal for adding the prize ribbons to the chain.

steps.headline: Pierce small holes at the top of the award ribbons.
steps.description: Thread a jump ring through this hole for each award ribbon.

steps.headline: Thread the jump ring through one loop in the chain.
steps.description: Use pliers to close it tightly. Repeat along the chain for each award ribbon. You can place the ribbons in each consecutive chain hole, or space them evenly across the chain, allowing space for the size of the award ribbon.

steps.headline: Hang the chain up in your chosen place.
steps.description: Use hook hangers to hold the chain ends firmly in place.

steps.headline: Find or make a rectangular piece of wood.
steps.description: It should be long enough for the award ribbons to hang across it with ease. Cut and sand the wood, if needed.

steps.headline: Decide whether you'll decorate the wood piece.
steps.description: You could simply oil or varnish the wood as it is, or paint it and add designs or letters.

steps.headline: Add cup hooks along the length of the wood piece.
steps.description: Screw these in along the lower bottom edge of the wood piece, spaced evenly to allow space for the award ribbons to hang from.

steps.headline: Add a hanger to the back of the wood piece.
Add loops to the award ribbons if needed.
steps.description: Simply glue or sew basic loops on the award ribbons, using any of the following: ribbon, string, embroidery thread, yarn, etc.

steps.headline: Hang up the wooden award row.
steps.description: Hang the award ribbons from the hooks.

text:
Ribbon award chain Choose ribbon or string. The ribbon or string must be strong and of a suitable length. Measure the length needed. Lay the award ribbons down, side by side. Do you want them right next to each other, or with a gap between them? This should be included in the final measurement. Also leave a little bit extra at each end of the ribbon or string, for hanging with. Cut ribbon or string to the measurement you've decided upon.  Attach the award ribbons to the ribbon or string. There are several possible ways for doing this, including these ones:
Attach the award ribbons from any loop or hanger the ribbons have; or attach a loop to them. If the award ribbons don't have a hole in them, you might consider punching one into it and threading it onto the ribbon or string. Just staple or tape the award ribbons to the ribbon or string length. Clip in place using small hair clips, paperclips or small stationery clips. Hang up the award ribbon chain in your chosen place. And you're done! Metallic award chain Purchase a length of chain from the hardware store. Take along a measurement that you have already chosen; do this by measuring the area where you'll hang the ribbons. Find jump rings. These are the wire joining rings used for jewelry making and are ideal for adding the prize ribbons to the chain. Pierce small holes at the top of the award ribbons. Thread a jump ring through this hole for each award ribbon. Thread the jump ring through one loop in the chain. Use pliers to close it tightly. Repeat along the chain for each award ribbon. You can place the ribbons in each consecutive chain hole, or space them evenly across the chain, allowing space for the size of the award ribbon. Hang the chain up in your chosen place. Use hook hangers to hold the chain ends firmly in place. Wooden award row Find or make a rectangular piece of wood. It should be long enough for the award ribbons to hang across it with ease. Cut and sand the wood, if needed. Decide whether you'll decorate the wood piece. You could simply oil or varnish the wood as it is, or paint it and add designs or letters. Add cup hooks along the length of the wood piece. Screw these in along the lower bottom edge of the wood piece, spaced evenly to allow space for the award ribbons to hang from. Add a hanger to the back of the wood piece.  Add loops to the award ribbons if needed. Simply glue or sew basic loops on the award ribbons, using any of the following: ribbon, string, embroidery thread, yarn, etc. Hang up the wooden award row. Hang the award ribbons from the hooks.
